intro: Chaerophyllum anthriscus, commonly known as cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feather-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable plant for both ecological and ornamental purposes.
